docs.text: Welcome to MkDocs For full documentation visit mkdocs.org . Install MKDocs pip install mkdocs pip install pymdownx pip install pyembed Commands mkdocs new [dir-name] - Create a new project. mkdocs serve - Start the live-reloading docs server. mkdocs build - Build the documentation site. mkdocs -h - Print help message and exit. Sample # create project folder mkdir mkdocs_test cd mkdocs_test # create new mkdocs project in this directory mkdocs new . # site/ -> gitignore echo "site/" >> .gitignore # start serve mkdocs serve # build Site mkdocs build # push to github gh-pages mkdocs gh-deploy # push to gitlab ci - reference: [https://gitlab.com/pages/mkdocs/commit/48f7b16f3d1ce0bf4b8fd30b29b3ef94b77e496d](https://gitlab.com/pages/mkdocs/commit/48f7b16f3d1ce0bf4b8fd30b29b3ef94b77e496d) - create .gitlab-ci.yml file image: python:3.8-buster before_script: - pip install mkdocs ## Add your custom theme if not inside a theme_dir ## (https://github.com/mkdocs/mkdocs/wiki/MkDocs-Themes) # - pip install mkdocs-material pages: script: - mkdocs build - mv site public artifacts: paths: - public only: - master Project layout mkdocs.yml # The configuration file. docs/ index.md # The documentation homepage. ... # Other markdown pages, images and other files. MKDocs Extension https://python-markdown.github.io/extensions/ https://facelessuser.github.io/pymdown-extensions/ https://github.com/Python-Markdown/markdown/wiki/Third-Party-Extensions https://github.com/pyembed/pyembed-markdown https://github.com/mkdocs/mkdocs/wiki/MkDocs-Plugins MKDocs Plugin https://www.mkdocs.org/user-guide/plugins/#developing-plugins
docs.title: Home

docs.text: mkdocs new [dir-name] - Create a new project. mkdocs serve - Start the live-reloading docs server. mkdocs build - Build the documentation site. mkdocs -h - Print help message and exit. Sample # create project folder mkdir mkdocs_test cd mkdocs_test # create new mkdocs project in this directory mkdocs new . # site/ -> gitignore echo "site/" >> .gitignore # start serve mkdocs serve # build Site mkdocs build # push to github gh-pages mkdocs gh-deploy # push to gitlab ci - reference: [https://gitlab.com/pages/mkdocs/commit/48f7b16f3d1ce0bf4b8fd30b29b3ef94b77e496d](https://gitlab.com/pages/mkdocs/commit/48f7b16f3d1ce0bf4b8fd30b29b3ef94b77e496d) - create .gitlab-ci.yml file image: python:3.8-buster before_script: - pip install mkdocs ## Add your custom theme if not inside a theme_dir ## (https://github.com/mkdocs/mkdocs/wiki/MkDocs-Themes) # - pip install mkdocs-material pages: script: - mkdocs build - mv site public artifacts: paths: - public only: - master
docs.title: Commands

docs.title: Project layout

docs.text: How to add logo in mkdocs 1. Edit readthedocs base.thml /home/$USERNAME/anaconda3/envs/python37/lib/python3.7/site-packages/mkdocs/themes/readthedocs/base.html Replace {{ config.site_name }} With {{ config.site_name }} 2. add logo path in mkdocs.yml Logo Path: docs/sources/images/logo.png site_name: 'Name' theme: readthedocs logo: 'sources/images/logo.png'
docs.title: How To Add Logo
How to add logo in mkdocs

docs.text: /home/$USERNAME/anaconda3/envs/python37/lib/python3.7/site-packages/mkdocs/themes/readthedocs/base.html Replace {{ config.site_name }} With {{ config.site_name }}
docs.title: 1. Edit readthedocs base.thml

docs.text: Logo Path: docs/sources/images/logo.png site_name: 'Name' theme: readthedocs logo: 'sources/images/logo.png'
docs.title: 2. add logo path in mkdocs.yml

docs.text: How to change mkdocs maxwidth /home/$USERNAME/anaconda3/envs/python37/lib/python3.7/site-packages/mkdocs/themes/readthedocs/css/theme.css Replace .wy-nav-content { padding: 1.618em 3.236em; height: 100%; max-width: 800px; margin: auto } Width .wy-nav-content { padding: 1.618em 3.236em; height: 100%; max-width: 1000px; margin: auto }
docs.title: How To Change mkdocs MaxWidth

docs.text: /home/$USERNAME/anaconda3/envs/python37/lib/python3.7/site-packages/mkdocs/themes/readthedocs/css/theme.css Replace .wy-nav-content { padding: 1.618em 3.236em; height: 100%; max-width: 800px; margin: auto } Width .wy-nav-content { padding: 1.618em 3.236em; height: 100%; max-width: 1000px; margin: auto }
docs.title: How to change mkdocs maxwidth

docs.text:
Markdown Example # Markdown Example ## H2 ### H3 #### H4 ##### H5 ###### H6 H2 H3 H4 H5 H6 Italic Emphasis, aka italics, with *asterisks* or _underscores_. Emphasis, aka italics, with asterisks or underscores . Bold Strong emphasis, aka bold, with double **asterisks** or __underscores__. Strong emphasis, aka bold, with double asterisks or underscores . Bold with Italic Combined emphasis with **asterisks and _underscores_**. Combined emphasis with asterisks and underscores . Scratch Scratch this Scratch this Mark mark me mark me - fruit - banana - mango - pitaya fruit banana mango pitaya - `#F00` - `#F00A` - `#FF0000` - `#FF0000AA` - `RGB(0,255,0)` - `RGB(0%,100%,0%)` - `RGBA(0,255,0,0.3)` - `HSL(540,70%,50%)` - `HSLA(540,70%,50%,0.3)` #F00 #F00A #FF0000 #FF0000AA RGB(0,255,0) RGB(0%,100%,0%) RGBA(0,255,0,0.3) HSL(540,70%,50%) HSLA(540,70%,50%,0.3) Inline `code` has `back-ticks around` it. Inline code has back-ticks around it. >>> If you paste a message from somewhere else that spans multiple lines, you can quote that without having to manually prepend `>` to every line! >>> If you paste a message from somewhere else that spans multiple lines, you can quote that without having to manually prepend > to every line! Link [go back to home page](../index.md) go back to home page [go back to home page] [go back to home page]: ../index.md go back to home page Sphinx Python-Markdown 에서 아래 처럼 table 안에 있는 link 형식으로 작성 시 파싱 문제 있음 | header 1 | header 2 | header 3 | | --- | ------ |---------:| | cell 1 | cell 2 | [go back to home page](../index.md) | header 1 header 2 header 3 cell 1 cell 2 go back to home page Table | header 1 | header 2 | header 3 | | --- | ------ |---------:| | cell 1 | cell 2 | cell 3 | | cell 4 | cell 5 is longer | cell 6 is much longer than the others, but that's ok. It will eventually wrap the text when the cell is too large for the display size. | | cell 7 | | cell
9 | header 1 header 2 header 3 cell 1 cell 2 cell 3 cell 4 cell 5 is longer cell 6 is much longer than the others, but that's ok. It will eventually wrap the text when the cell is too large for the display size. cell 7 cell 9 source code Java ```javascript var s = "JavaScript syntax highlighting"; alert(s); ``` var s = "JavaScript syntax highlighting"; alert(s); python ```python def function(): #indenting works just fine in the fenced code block s = "Python syntax highlighting" print s try: from DistUtilsExtra.command import * except ImportError: print >> sys.stderr, 'To build Sphinx-Theme-Brandenburg you need https://launchpad.net/python-distutils-extra' sys.exit(1) def read_from_file(path): with open(path) as input: return input.read() ``` def function(): #indenting works just fine in the fenced code block s = "Python syntax highlighting" print s try: from DistUtilsExtra.command import * except ImportError: print >> sys.stderr, 'To build Sphinx-Theme-Brandenburg you need https://launchpad.net/python-distutils-extra' sys.exit(1) def read_from_file(path): with open(path) as input: return input.read() ruby ```ruby require 'redcarpet' markdown = Redcarpet.new("Hello World!") puts markdown.to_html ``` require 'redcarpet' markdown = Redcarpet.new("Hello World!") puts markdown.to_html text ``` No language indicated, so no syntax highlighting. s = "There is no highlighting for this." But let's throw in a tag. ``` No language indicated, so no syntax highlighting. s = "There is no highlighting for this." But let's throw in a tag. Task lists - [X] item 1 * [X] item A * [ ] item B more text + [x] item a + [ ] item b + [x] item c * [X] item C - [ ] item 2 - [ ] item 3 item 1 item A item B more text item a item b item c item C item 2 item 3 Emoji Sometimes you want to :monkey: around a bit and add some :star2: to your :speech_balloon:. Well we have a gift for you: :zap: You can use emoji anywhere GFM is supported. :v: You can use it to point out a :bug: or warn about :speak_no_evil: patches. And if someone improves your really :snail: code, send them some :birthday:. People will :heart: you for that. If you are new to this, don't be :fearful:. You can easily join the emoji :family:. All you need to do is to look up one of the supported codes. Consult the [Emoji Cheat Sheet](https://www.emojicopy.com) for a list of all supported emoji codes. :thumbsup: Sometimes you want to around a bit and add some to your . Well we have a gift for you: You can use emoji anywhere GFM is supported. You can use it to point out a or warn about patches. And if someone improves your really code, send them some . People will you for that. If you are new to this, don't be . You can easily join the emoji . All you need to do is to look up one of the supported codes. Consult the Emoji Cheat Sheet for a list of all supported emoji codes. Math $p(x|y) = \frac{p(y|x)p(x)}{p(y)}$, \(p(x|y) = \frac{p(y|x)p(x)}{p(y)}\). p(x|y) = \frac{p(y|x)p(x)}{p(y)} p(x|y) = \frac{p(y|x)p(x)}{p(y)} , p(x|y) = \frac{p(y|x)p(x)}{p(y)} p(x|y) = \frac{p(y|x)p(x)}{p(y)} . Reference: https://facelessuser.github.io/pymdown-extensions/extensions/arithmatex/ Image ![picture](../sources/images/ball1.gif) ![alt text1][logo] [logo]: ../sources/images/ball1.gif Video Youtube [!embed](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=YE7VzlLtp-4) Local HTML
Definition list
Is something people use sometimes.
Markdown in HTML
Does *not* work **very** well. HTML tags will work, in most cases.
Definition list Is something people use sometimes. Markdown in HTML Does *not* work **very** well. HTML tags will work , in most cases. Admonition mkdocs.yml 파일에 아래처럼 추가 하면 사용 할 수 있습니다. markdown_extensions: - admonition Note !!! note "Note Title" blabla blabla Note Title blabla blabla Tip !!! tip "Tip Title" blabla blabla Tip Title blabla blabla Warning !!! warning "Warning Title" blabla blabla Warning Title blabla blabla Danger !!! danger "Danger Title" blabla blabla Danger Title blabla blabla
